msContents.summary: This papyrus is a letter about problems between various tax-collectors concerning the quantity of grain received by them, and its shipment. Also a landowner is involved and forced by threat of being poisoned to do what other desire from him.

msItemStruct.note: Printed plate: Hoogendijk - van Minnen, plate XXXVII
Translation: P. L. Bat. 25 69 (see below, English)

condition.ab: The papyrus is broken off at the left, right and bottom part.

layout.ab: The recto has 7 lines across the fibers.
The verso has 7 lines along the fibers.

listBibl.bibl: F.A.J. Hoogendijk – P. van Minnen, Papyri, Ostraca, Parchments and Waxed Tablets in the Leiden Papyrological Institue (P.L. Bat. 25) (Papyrologica Lugduno-Batava 25, Leiden 1991), p. 246-248 P.Leid.Inst. 69 is also cited as P. L. Bat. 25 69

div.ab:
P. L. Bat. 25 69 (English)
Recto - - -] in order that also the part should be shipped by us instead of by you, and he said [- - - that the other(?)] tax-collectors shipped (the grain) among the first and if I need more grain in order that [- - -] and at the request he went down (to the ship?) and said that, what he wanted [- - - we shipped] among the first our grain, before the other tax-collectors [- - -] the landowner was drugged in order that he should accept more [- - -] sail on the tenth day to the estate and I hope that not [- - -] the month passed. [- - -] He showed us - - - Verso [- - -] - - - and if he had not communicated to me about - - - [- - -] - - - and I received the grain - - - more than the other tax-collectors - - - [- - -] - - - and in order that not be collected - - - [- - -] - - - the twentieth. However, from the first hour - - - [- - -] - - - there in order that - - - he spends time (?) for you on the grain - - -
